Class BaseScaleDependentRenderer

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, LegendInfo, Renderer, ScaleDependentRenderer
public class BaseScaleDependentRenderer
extends BaseRenderer
implements ScaleDependentRenderer

This is basic implementation of ScaleDependentRenderer interface.

inRange

public boolean inRange(double scale)
Description copied from interface: ScaleDependentRenderer
Determine if the given scale value is within the range defined within this ScaleDependentRenderer. This is just equivalent to determining if MinScale <= scale <= MaxScale

Specified by:
inRange in interface ScaleDependentRenderer
Returns:
true == in range, false == otherwise

inRange

public boolean inRange(DisplayArea display)
Description copied from interface: ScaleDependentRenderer
Convenience method, return true if the scale of the specified Display is within the range of the scale dependent renderer. This method can be used to determine in advance of performing a dataset search, whether or not data will be rendered by this renderer

Specified by:
inRange in interface ScaleDependentRenderer
Parameters:
display - the Display that may be rendered upon
Returns:
true == in range, false == otherwise

isRendered

public int isRendered(double scale)
Description copied from interface: Renderer
determines if any or all parts of this Renderer are rendered at the given map scale

Specified by:
isRendered in interface Renderer
Overrides:
isRendered in class BaseRenderer
Parameters:
scale - -- the map scale to test (you can obtain this from ui.bean.Map.getScale())
Returns:
0 == nothing rendered (there are scale dependent renderers). 1 == some, but not all parts are rendered (there are scale dependent renderers), 2 == all parts are rendered (there are scale dependent renderers), 3 == all parts are rendered (there are no scale dependent renderers).
